name: ZMS
comment: Copyright 2016 Yahoo Inc. Licensed under the terms of the Apache version 2.0 license. See LICENSE file for terms. The Authorization Management Service (ZMS) Classes

StringTypeDef.name: SimpleName
StringTypeDef.comment: Copyright 2016 Yahoo Inc. Licensed under the terms of the Apache version 2.0 license. See LICENSE file for terms. Common name types used by several API definitions A simple identifier, an element of compound name.

StringTypeDef.name: CompoundName
StringTypeDef.comment: A compound name. Most names in this API are compound names.

StringTypeDef.name: DomainName
StringTypeDef.comment: A domain name is the general qualifier prefix, as its uniqueness is managed.

StringTypeDef.name: EntityName
StringTypeDef.comment: An entity name is a short form of a resource name, including only the domain and entity.

StringTypeDef.name: ServiceName
StringTypeDef.comment: A service name will generally be a unique subdomain.

StringTypeDef.name: LocationName
StringTypeDef.comment: A location name is not yet defined, but will be a dotted name like everything else.

StringTypeDef.name: ResourceName
StringTypeDef.comment: A resource name Note that the EntityName part is optional, that is, a domain name followed by a colon is valid resource name.

StringTypeDef.name: ResourceNames
StringTypeDef.comment: A comma separated list of resource names

StringTypeDef.name: YEncoded
StringTypeDef.comment: YEncoded includes ybase64 chars, as well as = and %. This can represent a user cookie and URL-encoded values.

StringTypeDef.name: AuthorityName
StringTypeDef.comment: Used as the prefix in a signed assertion. This uniquely identifies a signing authority.

StringTypeDef.name: SignedToken
StringTypeDef.comment: A signed assertion if identity. i.e. the user cookie value. This token will only make sense to the authority that generated it, so it is beneficial to have something in the value that is cheaply recognized to quickly reject if it belongs to another authority. In addition to the YEncoded set our token includes ; to separate components and , to separate roles and : for IPv6 addresses

StringTypeDef.name: MemberName
StringTypeDef.comment: Role Member name - could be one of three values: *, DomainName.* or ServiceName[*]

StructTypeDef.name: DomainMeta
StructTypeDef.comment: Set of metadata attributes that all domains may have and can be changed.

fields.name: description
fields.comment: a description of the domain

fields.name: org
fields.comment: a reference to an Organization. (i.e. org:media)

fields.name: enabled
fields.comment: Future use only, currently not used

fields.name: auditEnabled
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not domain modifications should be logged for SOX+Auditing. If true, the auditRef parameter must be supplied(not empty) for any API defining it.

fields.name: account
fields.comment: associated cloud (i.e. aws) account id (system attribute - uniqueness check)

fields.name: ypmId
fields.comment: associated product id (system attribute - uniqueness check)

fields.name: applicationId
fields.comment: associated application id

fields.name: certDnsDomain
fields.comment: domain certificate dns domain (system attribute)

fields.name: memberExpiryDays
fields.comment: all user members in the domain will have specified max expiry days

fields.name: tokenExpiryMins
fields.comment: tokens issued for this domain will have specified max timeout in mins

fields.name: serviceCertExpiryMins
fields.comment: service identity certs issued for this domain will have specified max timeout in mins

fields.name: roleCertExpiryMins
fields.comment: role certs issued for this domain will have specified max timeout in mins

fields.name: signAlgorithm
fields.comment: rsa or ec signing algorithm to be used for tokens

fields.name: serviceExpiryDays
fields.comment: all services in the domain will have specified max expiry days

StructTypeDef.name: Domain
StructTypeDef.comment: A domain is an independent partition of users, roles, and resources. Its name represents the definition of a namespace; the only way a new namespace can be created, from the top, is by creating Domains. Administration of a domain is governed by the parent domain (using reverse-DNS namespaces). The top level domains are governed by the special "sys.auth" domain.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the common name to be referred to, the symbolic id. It is immutable

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the last modification timestamp of any object or attribute in this domain

fields.name: id
fields.comment: unique identifier of the domain. generated on create, never reused

StructTypeDef.name: DomainMetaList
StructTypeDef.comment: A list of domain objects with their meta attributes.

fields.name: domains
fields.comment: list of domain objects

StructTypeDef.name: RoleList
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for an enumeration of roles in the namespace, with pagination.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of role names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next role list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

StructTypeDef.name: RoleAuditLog
StructTypeDef.comment: An audit log entry for role membership change.

fields.name: member
fields.comment: name of the role member

fields.name: admin
fields.comment: name of the principal executing the change

fields.name: created
fields.comment: timestamp of the entry

fields.name: action
fields.comment: log action - e.g. add, delete, approve, etc

fields.name: auditRef
fields.comment: audit reference string for the change as supplied by admin

fields.name: memberName
fields.comment: name of the member

fields.name: expiration
fields.comment: the expiration timestamp

fields.name: active
fields.comment: Flag to indicate whether membership is active

fields.name: approved
fields.comment: Flag to indicate whether membership is approved either by delegates ( in case of auditEnabled roles ) or by domain admins ( in case of selfserve roles )

fields.name: auditRef
fields.comment: audit reference string for the change as supplied by admin

fields.name: requestTime
fields.comment: for pending membership requests, the request time

fields.name: lastNotifiedTime
fields.comment: for pending membership requests, time when last notification was sent

fields.name: requestPrincipal
fields.comment: pending members only - name of the principal requesting the change

StructTypeDef.name: RoleMeta
StructTypeDef.comment: Set of metadata attributes that all roles may have and can be changed by domain admins.

fields.name: selfServe
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not role allows self service. Users can add themselves in the role, but it has to be approved by domain admins to be effective.

fields.name: memberExpiryDays
fields.comment: all user members in the role will have specified max expiry days

fields.name: tokenExpiryMins
fields.comment: tokens issued for this role will have specified max timeout in mins

fields.name: certExpiryMins
fields.comment: certs issued for this role will have specified max timeout in mins

fields.name: signAlgorithm
fields.comment: rsa or ec signing algorithm to be used for tokens

fields.name: serviceExpiryDays
fields.comment: all services in the role will have specified max expiry days

fields.name: reviewEnabled
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not role updates require another review and approval

fields.name: notifyRoles
fields.comment: list of roles whose members should be notified for member review/approval

StructTypeDef.name: Role
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a Role with set of members.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the role

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp of the role

fields.name: members
fields.comment: an explicit list of members. Might be empty or null, if trust is set

fields.name: roleMembers
fields.comment: members with expiration

fields.name: trust
fields.comment: a trusted domain to delegate membership decisions to

fields.name: auditLog
fields.comment: an audit log for role membership changes

fields.name: auditEnabled
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not role updates should require GRC approval. If true, the auditRef parameter must be supplied(not empty) for any API defining it

fields.name: lastReviewedDate
fields.comment: last review timestamp of the role

StructTypeDef.name: Roles
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a list of roles with full details

fields.name: list
fields.comment: list of role objects

StructTypeDef.name: Membership
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a role membership.

fields.name: memberName
fields.comment: name of the member

fields.name: isMember
fields.comment: flag to indicate whether or the user is a member or not

fields.name: roleName
fields.comment: name of the role

fields.name: expiration
fields.comment: the expiration timestamp

fields.name: active
fields.comment: Flag to indicate whether membership is active

fields.name: approved
fields.comment: Flag to indicate whether membership is approved either by delegates ( in case of auditEnabled roles ) or by domain admins ( in case of selfserve roles )

fields.name: auditRef
fields.comment: audit reference string for the change as supplied by admin

fields.name: requestPrincipal
fields.comment: pending members only - name of the principal requesting the change

StructTypeDef.name: DefaultAdmins
StructTypeDef.comment: The list of domain administrators.

fields.name: admins
fields.comment: list of domain administrators

fields.name: roleName
fields.comment: name of the role

fields.name: domainName
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: memberName
fields.comment: name of the member

fields.name: expiration
fields.comment: the expiration timestamp

fields.name: active
fields.comment: Flag to indicate whether membership is active

fields.name: auditRef
fields.comment: audit reference string for the change as supplied by admin

fields.name: requestPrincipal
fields.comment: pending members only - name of the principal requesting the change

fields.name: requestTime
fields.comment: for pending membership requests, the request time

fields.name: memberName
fields.comment: name of the member

fields.name: memberRoles
fields.comment: roles for this member

fields.name: domainName
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: members
fields.comment: role members

StructTypeDef.name: RoleSystemMeta
StructTypeDef.comment: Set of system metadata attributes that all roles may have and can be changed by system admins.

fields.name: auditEnabled
fields.comment: Flag indicates whether or not role updates should be approved by GRC. If true, the auditRef parameter must be supplied(not empty) for any API defining it.

EnumTypeDef.name: AssertionEffect
EnumTypeDef.comment: Every assertion can have the effect of ALLOW or DENY.

StructTypeDef.name: Assertion
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation for the encapsulation of an action to be performed on a resource by a principal.

fields.name: role
fields.comment: the subject of the assertion - a role

fields.name: resource
fields.comment: the object of the assertion. Must be in the local namespace. Can contain wildcards

fields.name: action
fields.comment: the predicate of the assertion. Can contain wildcards

fields.name: effect
fields.comment: the effect of the assertion in the policy language

fields.name: id
fields.comment: assertion id - auto generated by server. Not required during put operations.

StructTypeDef.name: Policy
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a Policy with set of assertions.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the policy

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp of this policy

fields.name: assertions
fields.comment: list of defined assertions for this policy

StructTypeDef.name: Policies
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation of list of policy objects

fields.name: list
fields.comment: list of policy objects

StructTypeDef.name: PublicKeyEntry
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation of the public key in a service identity object.

fields.name: key
fields.comment: the public key for the service

fields.name: id
fields.comment: the key identifier (version or zone name)

StructTypeDef.name: ServiceIdentity
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation of the service identity object.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the full name of the service, i.e. "sports.storage"

fields.name: description
fields.comment: description of the service

fields.name: publicKeys
fields.comment: array of public keys for key rotation

fields.name: providerEndpoint
fields.comment: if present, then this service can provision tenants via this endpoint.

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the timestamp when this entry was last modified

fields.name: executable
fields.comment: the path of the executable that runs the service

fields.name: hosts
fields.comment: list of host names that this service can run on

fields.name: user
fields.comment: local (unix) user name this service can run as

fields.name: group
fields.comment: local (unix) group name this service can run as

StructTypeDef.name: ServiceIdentities
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation of list of services

fields.name: list
fields.comment: list of services

StructTypeDef.name: ServiceIdentityList
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for an enumeration of services in the namespace, with pagination.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of service names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next service list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

StructTypeDef.name: ServiceIdentitySystemMeta
StructTypeDef.comment: Set of system metadata attributes that all services may have and can be changed by system admins.

fields.name: providerEndpoint
fields.comment: provider callback endpoint

StructTypeDef.name: Template
StructTypeDef.comment: Solution Template object defined on the server

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: list of roles in the template

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies defined in this template

fields.name: services
fields.comment: list of services defined in this template

StructTypeDef.name: TemplateList
StructTypeDef.comment: List of template names that is the base struct for server and domain templates

fields.name: templateNames
fields.comment: list of template names

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the parameter

fields.name: value
fields.comment: value of the parameter

StructTypeDef.name: DomainTemplate
StructTypeDef.comment: solution template(s) to be applied to a domain

fields.name: params
fields.comment: optional template parameters

StructTypeDef.name: DomainTemplateList
StructTypeDef.comment: List of solution templates to be applied to a domain

StructTypeDef.name: ServerTemplateList
StructTypeDef.comment: List of solution templates available in the server

StructTypeDef.name: DomainList
StructTypeDef.comment: A paginated list of domains.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of domain names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next domain list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

StructTypeDef.name: TopLevelDomain
StructTypeDef.comment: Top Level Domain object. The required attributes include the name of the domain and list of domain administrators.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: adminUsers
fields.comment: list of domain administrators

fields.name: templates
fields.comment: list of solution template names

StructTypeDef.name: SubDomain
StructTypeDef.comment: A Subdomain is a TopLevelDomain, except it has a parent.

fields.name: parent
fields.comment: name of the parent domain

StructTypeDef.name: UserDomain
StructTypeDef.comment: A UserDomain is the user's own top level domain in user - e.g. user.hga

fields.name: name
fields.comment: user id which will be the domain name

fields.name: templates
fields.comment: list of solution template names

StructTypeDef.name: DanglingPolicy
StructTypeDef.comment: A dangling policy where the assertion is referencing a role name that doesn't exist in the domain

StructTypeDef.name: DomainDataCheck
StructTypeDef.comment: Domain data object representing the results of a check operation looking for dangling roles, policies and trust relationships that are set either on tenant or provider side only

fields.name: danglingRoles
fields.comment: Names of roles not specified in any assertion. Might be empty or null if no dangling roles.

fields.name: danglingPolicies
fields.comment: Policy+role tuples where role doesnt exist. Might be empty or null if no dangling policies.

fields.name: policyCount
fields.comment: total number of policies

fields.name: assertionCount
fields.comment: total number of assertions

fields.name: roleWildCardCount
fields.comment: total number of assertions containing roles as wildcards

fields.name: providersWithoutTrust
fields.comment: Service names (domain.service) that dont contain trust role if this is a tenant domain. Might be empty or null, if not a tenant or if all providers support this tenant.

fields.name: tenantsWithoutAssumeRole
fields.comment: Names of Tenant domains that dont contain assume role assertions if this is a provider domain. Might be empty or null, if not a provider or if all tenants support use this provider.

StructTypeDef.name: Entity
StructTypeDef.comment: An entity is a name and a structured value. some entity names/prefixes are reserved (i.e. "role",  "policy", "meta", "domain", "service")

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the entity object

fields.name: value
fields.comment: value of the entity

StructTypeDef.name: EntityList
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for an enumeration of entities in the namespace

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of entity names

StructTypeDef.name: PolicyList
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for an enumeration of policies in the namespace, with pagination.

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of policy names

fields.name: next
fields.comment: if the response is a paginated list, this attribute specifies the value to be used in the next policy list request as the value for the skip query parameter.

StructTypeDef.name: Tenancy
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation of tenant.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: the domain that is to get a tenancy

fields.name: service
fields.comment: the provider service on which the tenancy is to reside

fields.name: resourceGroups
fields.comment: registered resource groups for this tenant

StructTypeDef.name: TenantRoleAction
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation of tenant role action.

fields.name: role
fields.comment: name of the role

fields.name: action
fields.comment: action value for the generated policy assertion

StructTypeDef.name: TenantResourceGroupRoles
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation of tenant roles for resource groups to be provisioned.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the provider domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the provider service

fields.name: tenant
fields.comment: name of the tenant domain

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: the role/action pairs to provision

fields.name: resourceGroup
fields.comment: tenant resource group

StructTypeDef.name: ProviderResourceGroupRoles
StructTypeDef.comment: A representation of provider roles to be provisioned.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the provider domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the provider service

fields.name: tenant
fields.comment: name of the tenant domain

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: the role/action pairs to provision

fields.name: resourceGroup
fields.comment: tenant resource group

StructTypeDef.name: Access
StructTypeDef.comment: Access can be checked and returned as this resource.

fields.name: granted
fields.comment: true (allowed) or false (denied)

StructTypeDef.name: DomainPolicies
StructTypeDef.comment: We need to include the name of the domain in this struct since this data will be passed back to ZPU through ZTS so we need to sign not only the list of policies but also the corresponding domain name that the policies belong to.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies defined in this server

StructTypeDef.name: SignedPolicies
StructTypeDef.comment: A signed bulk transfer of policies. The data is signed with server's private key.

fields.name: contents
fields.comment: list of policies defined in a domain

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: signature generated based on the domain policies object

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the identifier of the key used to generate the signature

StructTypeDef.name: DomainData
StructTypeDef.comment: A domain object that includes its roles, policies and services.

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: roles
fields.comment: list of roles in the domain

fields.name: policies
fields.comment: list of policies in the domain signed with ZMS private key

fields.name: services
fields.comment: list of services in the domain

fields.name: entities
fields.comment: list of entities in the domain

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: last modification timestamp

StructTypeDef.name: SignedDomain
StructTypeDef.comment: A domain object signed with server's private key. The signature and keyid are optional if the metaonly flag is set to true in the getSignedDomains api call

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: domain object with its roles, policies and services

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: signature generated based on the domain object

fields.name: keyId
fields.comment: the identifier of the key used to generate the signature

StructTypeDef.name: SignedDomains
StructTypeDef.comment: A list of signed domain objects

StructTypeDef.name: JWSDomain
StructTypeDef.comment: SignedDomain using flattened JWS JSON Serialization syntax. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7515#section-7.2.2

StructTypeDef.name: UserToken
StructTypeDef.comment: A user token generated based on user's credentials

fields.name: token
fields.comment: Signed user token identifying a specific authenticated user

fields.name: header
fields.comment: Authorization header name for the token

StructTypeDef.name: ServicePrincipal
StructTypeDef.comment: A service principal object identifying a given service.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: service
fields.comment: name of the service

fields.name: token
fields.comment: service's signed token

StructTypeDef.name: User
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a user

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the user

fields.name: names
fields.comment: list of user names

StructTypeDef.name: Quota
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a quota object

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name of the domain object

fields.name: subdomain
fields.comment: number of subdomains allowed (applied at top level domain level)

fields.name: role
fields.comment: number of roles allowed

fields.name: roleMember
fields.comment: number of members a role may have

fields.name: policy
fields.comment: number of policies allowed

fields.name: assertion
fields.comment: total number of assertions a policy may have

fields.name: entity
fields.comment: total number of entity objects

fields.name: service
fields.comment: number of services allowed

fields.name: serviceHost
fields.comment: number of hosts allowed per service

fields.name: publicKey
fields.comment: number of public keys per service

fields.name: modified
fields.comment: the last modification timestamp of the quota object

StructTypeDef.name: Status
StructTypeDef.comment: The representation for a status object

fields.name: code
fields.comment: status message code

fields.name: message
fields.comment: status message of the server

resources.comment: Get info for the specified domain, by name. This request only returns the configured domain attributes and not any domain objects like roles, policies or service identities.

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: name of the domain

resources.comment: Enumerate domains. Can be filtered by prefix and depth, and paginated. This operation can be expensive, as it may span multiple domains.

inputs.name: limit
inputs.comment: restrict the number of results in this call

inputs.name: skip
inputs.comment: restrict the set to those after the specified "next" token returned from a previous call

inputs.name: prefix
inputs.comment: restrict to names that start with the prefix

inputs.name: depth
inputs.comment: restrict the depth of the name, specifying the number of '.' characters that can appear

inputs.name: account
inputs.comment: restrict to domain names that have specified account name

inputs.name: productId
inputs.comment: restrict the domain names that have specified product id

inputs.name: roleMember
inputs.comment: restrict the domain names where the specified user is in a role - see roleName

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: restrict the domain names where the specified user is in this role - see roleMember

inputs.name: modifiedSince
inputs.comment: This header specifies to the server to return any domains modified since this HTTP date

resources.comment: Create a new top level domain. This is a privileged action for the "sys.auth" administrators.

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: TopLevelDomain object to be created

resources.comment: Create a new subdomain. The domain administrators of the {parent} domain have the privilege to create subdomains.

inputs.name: parent
inputs.comment: name of the parent domain

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: Subdomain object to be created

resources.comment: Create a new user domain. The user domain will be created in the user top level domain and the user himself will be set as the administrator for this domain.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain which will be the user id

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: UserDomain object to be created

resources.comment: Delete the specified domain.  This is a privileged action for the "sys.auth" administrators. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be deleted

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Delete the specified subdomain. Caller must have domain delete permissions in parent. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: parent
inputs.comment: name of the parent domain

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the subdomain to be deleted

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Delete the specified userdomain. Caller must have domain delete permissions in the domain. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be deleted which will be the user id

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Update the specified top level domain metadata. Note that entities in the domain are not affected. Caller must have update privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: DomainMeta object with updated attribute values

resources.comment: Set the specified top level domain metadata. Note that entities in the domain are not affected. Caller must have update privileges on the domain itself. If the system attribute is one of the string attributes, then the caller must also have delete action on the same resource in order to reset the configured value

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: attribute
inputs.comment: name of the system attribute to be modified

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: DomainMeta object with updated attribute values

resources.name: PutDomainSystemMeta

resources.comment: Update the given domain by applying the roles and policies defined in the specified solution template(s). Caller must have UPDATE privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: domainTemplate
inputs.comment: DomainTemplate object with solution template name(s)

resources.comment: Update the given domain by applying the roles and policies defined in the specified solution template(s). Caller must have UPDATE privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: template
inputs.comment: name of the solution template

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: domainTemplate
inputs.comment: DomainTemplate object with a single template name to match URI

resources.name: PutDomainTemplateExt

resources.comment: Get the list of solution templates applied to a domain

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain

resources.comment: Update the given domain by deleting the specified template from the domain template list. Cycles through the roles and policies defined in the template and deletes them. Caller must have delete privileges on the domain itself.

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be updated

inputs.name: template
inputs.comment: name of the solution template

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Carry out data check operation for the specified domain.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

resources.comment: Put an entity into the domain.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: entityName
inputs.comment: name of entity

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: entity
inputs.comment: Entity object to be added to the domain

resources.comment: Get a entity from a domain. open for all authenticated users to read

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: entityName
inputs.comment: name of entity

resources.comment: Delete the entity from the domain. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: entityName
inputs.comment: name of entity

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Enumerate entities provisioned in this domain.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

resources.comment: Enumerate roles provisioned in this domain.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: limit
inputs.comment: restrict the number of results in this call

inputs.name: skip
inputs.comment: restrict the set to those after the specified "next" token returned from a previous call

resources.comment: Get the list of all roles in a domain with optional flag whether or not include members

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: members
inputs.comment: return list of members in the role

resources.comment: Get the specified role in the domain.

inputs.comment: name of the domain

resources.comment: Add the specified user to the role's member list. If the role is neither auditEnabled nor selfserve, then it will use authorize ("update", "{domainName}:role.{roleName}") otherwise membership will be sent for approval to either designated delegates ( in case of auditEnabled roles ) or to domain admins ( in case of selfserve roles )

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: name of the role

inputs.name: memberName
inputs.comment: name of the user to be added as a member

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: membership
inputs.comment: Membership object (must contain role/member names as specified in the URI)

resources.comment: Delete the specified role membership. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: name of the role

inputs.name: memberName
inputs.comment: name of the user to be removed as a member

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.comment: Delete the specified pending role membership. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned). Authorization will be completed within the server itself since there are two possibilities: 1) The domain admins can delete any pending requests 2) the requestor can also delete his/her own pending request.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.comment: name of the role

inputs.name: memberName
inputs.comment: name of the user to be removed as a pending member

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

resources.name: DeletePendingMembership

resources.comment: Verify and, if necessary, fix domain roles and policies to make sure the given set of users have administrative access to the domain. This request is only restricted to "sys.auth" domain administrators and can be used when the domain administrators incorrectly have blocked their own access to their domains.

inputs.name: domainName
inputs.comment: name of the domain

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit param required(not empty) if domain auditEnabled is true.

inputs.name: defaultAdmins
inputs.comment: list of domain administrators

resources.comment: Set the specified role metadata. Caller must have update privileges on the sys.auth domain. If the system attribute is one of the string attributes, then the caller must also have delete action on the same resource in order to reset the configured value

inputs.name: detail

resources.comment: Approve or Reject the request to add specified user to role membership. This endpoint will be used by 2 use cases: 1. inputs.name: auditRef

inputs.name: membership
inputs.comment: Membership object (must contain role/member names as specified in the URI)

resources.comment: Check access for the specified operation on the specified resource for the currently authenticated user. This is the slow centralized access for control-plane purposes. Use distributed mechanisms for decentralized (data-plane) access by fetching signed policies and role tokens for users. With this endpoint the resource is part of the uri and restricted to its strict definition of resource name. If needed, you can use the GetAccessExt api that allows resource name to be less restrictive.

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion, i.e. update or read

inputs.name: resource
inputs.comment: the resource to check access against, i.e. "media.news:articles"

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, it specifies an alternate domain for cross-domain trust relation

inputs.name: checkPrincipal
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, carry out the access check for this principal

resources.comment: Check access for the specified operation on the specified resource for the currently authenticated user. This is the slow centralized access for control-plane purposes.

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion, i.e. update or read

inputs.name: resource
inputs.comment: the resource to check access against, i.e. "media.news:articles"

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, it specifies an alternate domain for cross-domain trust relation

inputs.name: checkPrincipal
inputs.comment: usually null. If present, carry out the access check for this principal

resources.name: GetAccessExt

resources.comment: Return list of resources that the given principal has access to. Even though the principal is marked as optional, it must be specified unless the caller has authorization from sys.auth domain to check access for all user principals. (action: access, resource: resource-lookup-all)

inputs.name: principal
inputs.comment: specifies principal to query the resource list for

inputs.name: action
inputs.comment: action as specified in the policy assertion

resources.comment: Retrieve the list of modified domains since the specified timestamp. The server will return the list of all modified domains and the latest modification timestamp as the value of the ETag header. The client will need to use this value during its next call to request the changes since the previous request. When metaonly set to true, dont add roles, policies or services, dont sign

inputs.name: domain
inputs.comment: filter the domain list only to the specified name

inputs.name: metaOnly
inputs.comment: valid values are "true" or "false"

inputs.name: metaAttr
inputs.comment: domain meta attribute to filter/return, valid values "account", "ypmId", or "all"

inputs.name: master
inputs.comment: for system principals only - request data from master data store and not read replicas if any are configured

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any domains modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the domain to be retrieved

resources.comment: Return a user/principal token for the specified authenticated user. Typical authenticated users with their native credentials are not allowed to update their domain data. They must first obtain a UserToken and then use that token for authentication and authorization of their update requests.

inputs.name: userName
inputs.comment: name of the user

inputs.name: serviceNames
inputs.comment: comma separated list of on-behalf-of service names

inputs.name: header
inputs.comment: include Authorization header name in response

resources.comment: CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) support to allow Provider Services to obtain AuthorizedService Tokens on behalf of Tenant administrators

inputs.name: userName
inputs.comment: name of the user

inputs.name: serviceNames
inputs.comment: comma separated list of on-behalf-of service names

resources.comment: Return a ServicePrincipal object if the serviceToken is valid. This request provides a simple operation that an external application can execute to validate a service token.
Get the list of solution templates defined in the server
Get solution template details. Includes the roles and policies that will be automatically provisioned when the template is applied to a domain

inputs.name: template
inputs.comment: name of the solution template

resources.comment: Enumerate users that are registered as principals in the system This will return only the principals with "<user-domain>." prefix

Delete the specified user. This command will delete the home.<name> domain and all of its sub-domains (if they exist) and remove the user.<name> from all the roles in the system that it's member of. Upon successful completion of this delete request, the server will return NO_CONTENT status code without any data (no object will be returned).

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name of the user

inputs.name: auditRef
inputs.comment: Audit reference
